SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
The GameController class handles the logic and flow of the game. It is responsible for processing messages received from the clients, updating the game state, and notifying listeners accordingly.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController()

  • Method Details

    • createGame

      public void createGame(GameLobby gameLobby) throws Exception
      Creates a new game with the specified lobby and player nicknames. Initializes the game and model view.
      Parameters:
      gameLobby - The game lobby containing the players of the game.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during game creation.

    • addListeners

      public void addListeners(GameLobby gameLobby) throws IOException
      Associates listeners with the game lobby.
      Parameters:
      gameLobby - The game lobby to associate listeners with.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getModel

      public Game getModel()
      Returns the game model.
      Returns:
      The game model.

    • setGame

      public void setGame(Game game)
      Sets the game model.
      Parameters:
      game - The game model to be set.

    • receiveMessageFromClient

      public void receiveMessageFromClient(Message message)
      Receives a message from the client and performs the corresponding actions based on the current player and phase. If the message is not from the current player or the phase is incorrect, it triggers the ErrorListener.
      Parameters:
      message - The message received from the client.

    • checkError

      public boolean checkError(ErrorType possibleInvalidArgument) throws Exception
      Checks if there is an error and triggers the errorListener if an error is found.
      Parameters:
      possibleInvalidArgument - The ErrorType indicating a possible error. If null, it means that no error has occurred.
      Returns:
      True if an error is found, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the process.

    • checkAndInsertBoardBox

      public void checkAndInsertBoardBox(Message message) throws Exception
      Checks and inserts the selected board box during the tiles selection phase. If all checks pass, it sets the turnPhase of the modelView to TurnPhase.SELECT_ORDER_TILES and updates the tiles selected by the client in the modelView.
      Parameters:
      message - The message from the client.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the process.

    • permutePlayerTiles

      public void permutePlayerTiles(Message message) throws Exception
      Permute the order of the selected tiles in the order phase. If all checks pass, it sets the turnPhase of the modelView to TurnPhase.SELECT_COLUMN and updates the tile order in the modelView.
      Parameters:
      message - The message from the client.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the process.

    • selectingColumn

      public void selectingColumn(Message message) throws Exception
      Process the column selection phase. If all checks pass, it updates the players' scores and sets the turnPhase of the modelView to TurnPhase.SELECT_FROM_BOARD.
      Parameters:
      message - The message from the client.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the process.

    • finishTurn

      public void finishTurn()
      Finish the current turn. If all checks pass, it sets the next player and notifies the EndTurnListener.

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      End the game. It notifies the InfoAndEndGameListener, and then the endGame message will be sent.

    • illegalPhase

      public void illegalPhase(TurnPhase phase) throws Exception
      Check if the received phase is a legal phase in the current game state. If the phase is not valid, it calls the errorListener.
      Parameters:
      phase - The phase of the client message.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the process.

    • send

      public void send(KeyAbstractPayload event, String playerNickname, Object newValue)
      Send the specified event to the corresponding listener based on the number of active players. If the number of active players is greater than 1, it awakens the relative listener. Otherwise, it means that either no player is connected or only one player is connected. In this case, the data has been updated to the last phase received, but the message for the next phase is not sent.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to send (error, end of phase, or end of turn).
      playerNickname - The nickname of the current or next player, depending on the phase.
      newValue - The updated modelView or current phase.

    • disconnectionPlayer

      public void disconnectionPlayer(String nickname)
      Called from the gameLobby after a player disconnects. If there are connected players and the disconnected player is the current turn player, it sets the next player and wakes up the EndTurnListener.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the disconnected player.

    • reconnectionPlayer

      public void reconnectionPlayer(String nickname)
      Called from the gameLobby after a player reconnects. If there are two connected players, it wakes up the InfoAndEndGameListener. Additionally, if the current turn player is not active, it sets the next active player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the reconnected player.

    • getTurnNickname

      public String getTurnNickname()
      Returns the nickname of the current turn player.
      Returns:
      The nickname of the current turn player.

    • getActivePlayers

      public Boolean[] getActivePlayers()
      Returns the array of the modelView indicating the active status of each player.
      Returns:
      An array of booleans where each element represents the active status of a player.
